intro: Zephyranthes brevipes, commonly known as the rain lily, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States and parts of Mexico. It is a bulbous perennial that produces delicate, white or pale pink flowers during the rainy season. The plant has strap-like, grassy leaves that are evergreen and can grow up to 12 inches in length. Zephyranthes brevipes thrives in well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade. It is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to bloom quickly after rainfall.
